newsitem.title: CANADA: North and Central America port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: North and Central America port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --
CANADA, May 5 - Montreal, Que. - All terminals operating normally, no delays expected.

HONDURAS, May 5 - Puerto Cortes - Five vessels berthed of which 3 discharging/loading containers, 2 discharging (1 corn, 1 urea). 5 awaiting berths of which 4 to discharge/load containers, 1 to discharge steel. 11 due of which 5 to discharge bananas, 1 passenger, 1 to discharge steel coils, 4 to load/discharge containers.

MEXICO, May 6 - All ports working normally. Tampico - Nine vessels in port of which 2 general cargo, 2 sugar, 2 corn, 2 cement, 1 under repair. Altamira - Three vessels in port of which 2 containers, 1 heavy goods. Veracruz - 17 in port of which 4 grain, 3 corn, 3 sugar, 2 general cargo, 3 containers, 2 oil tankers. Manzanillo - Nine vessels in port of which 2 general cargo, 2 cement, 1 clinker, 2 containers, 2 urea. Coatzacoalcos - 17 in port of which 9 tankers, 7 chemicals, 1 under repair.

PANAMA, May 5 - Cristobal - 12 vessels in port of which 5 operating. Balboa - 18 in port of which 3 operating. Panama canal - waterway operating at full capacity. Based on present and projected number of vessels awaiting transit, authorities announced that effective 0001 7/5 booking condition 3 will be in effect until further notice. While this is in effect available booking slots will be reduced and those vessels transiting during this period will be charged the higher booking fee. 51 vessels due, 91 in queue, 16 booked, 41 scheduled, 4/5 - actual arrivals 35, transits 39, Average of booked and non-booked canal waters high at 60.4 hours. The queue at 6/5 is expected to rise to 101 vessels.
